question: 越える
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>go beyond</kanji>, the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to go beyond</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

<vocabulary>To go beyond</vocabulary> <reading>child</reading> (<ja>こ</ja>) years in order to become an adult, you have to be 18 years old in both the USA and Japan.
